alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:57AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Sullivan and central Pike Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 256 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greeley, or 13 miles northwest of Montague, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monticello, Lackawaxen, Shohola, Eldred, Glen Spey, Greeley, Highland Lake, Millrift, Hartwood and Oakland. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 104 and 106. Interstate 84 near 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Flooded roads are especially hard to recognize at night. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
